segments.text: I can't believe how calm everything looks outside that window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden is so neat and tidy, it's like a perfect little world out there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, it's total chaos, and no one even seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out of the sink, and the woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I mean, look at that puddle! It's getting bigger and bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids, they're being so naughty, taking those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool looks so wobbly, I'm surprised it hasn't tipped over yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the girl is egging him on, looking at him with those expectant eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like no one in this kitchen has any common sense.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I would never let my kitchen get like this, it's just asking for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR
